content:
https://adam.math.hhu.de/#/g/trequetrum/lean4game-logic/world/IffIntro/level/7

Using only exact and have, I am having trouble writing the proof terms for this level, where the goal is:

example (P Q R : Prop): (P ∧ Q ↔ R ∧ Q) ↔ Q → (P ↔ R) := by

So far, I have been able to write a few assumptions with have based on what I know about writing proof terms, here as follows but this is not exactly what is required. For example, I wrote:

have h1 := λ(pq : P ∧ Q)(rq : R ∧ Q) ↦ λ(q : Q) ↦ λ(p : P) ↦ rq.left
have h2 := λ(rq : R ∧ Q)(pq : P ∧ Q) ↦ λ(q : Q) ↦ λ(p : P) ↦ rq.left

which gives me P ∧ Q → R ∧ Q → Q → P → R and R ∧ Q → P ∧ Q → Q → P → R,
but what I really want to write is (P ∧ Q → R ∧ Q) → Q → (P → R) and (R ∧ Q → P ∧ Q) → Q → (P → R). How do I write proof terms with the above brackets?

Any help on how to step by step tackle this level? I do get kind of lost writing the whole thing in one exact expression also.

what I really want to write is (P ∧ Q → R ∧ Q) → Q → (P → R)

If you fully disambiguate this with parens, it looks like this:

((P ∧ Q) → (R ∧ Q)) → (Q → (P → R))

When I'm writing a term where the top level operation is an →, I make a λ expression with a variable for the thing of the left.

λ(h : P ∧ Q → R ∧ Q) ↦ (... : Q → P → R)

The ellipse above is a term where the top level operation is an → again

λ(h1 : P ∧ Q → R ∧ Q) ↦ λ(h2 : Q) ↦ (... : P → R)

The ellipse above is still a term like that

λ(h1 : P ∧ Q → R ∧ Q) ↦ λ(h2 : Q) ↦ λ(h3 : P) ↦ (... : R)

There are a few things I like to do to keep things a bit cleaner looking. Nested λ expressions have a nice syntactic sugar where you just list the variables.

λ(h1 : P ∧ Q → R ∧ Q) (h2 : Q) (h3 : P) ↦ (... : R)

and I think it's common in logic like this to name a term of type Q with the lowercase letter. Then you may as well drop the annotation as it's pretty clear.

λ(h : P ∧ Q → R ∧ Q) q p ↦ (... : R)

Now you need to start thinking about what you have an how it can be used to create new terms.

λ(h : P ∧ Q → R ∧ Q) q p ↦
    have pq : P ∧ Q := ⟨ p, q ⟩
    have rq : R ∧ Q := h pq
    (rq.left : R)

That's helpful, it is a bit clearer now how to have have's inside a have or an exact. I skipped the Set Theory Game, which I am doing now, to go straight to the Intro to Logic game, after finishing the Number game. I now finished the Intro to Logic game except this last IffBoss Level; I'll look more into it now!

(By the way, https://adam.math.hhu.de/#/g/trequetrum/lean4game-logic/world/IffTactic/level/5 Redux: ↔ World Tactics Level 5 / 7 : Rewriting, A Longer Level was no joke, learned a few tactic strats with cases h p, apply and_left/right and apply modus_tollens on not statements along the way).
Redux: ↔ World Tactics Level 5 / 7 needs work. It's definitely a bit of a spike in difficulty! You're not the first to note it.

Ok trying it out, I would like to have a have h1 : (P ∧ Q → R ∧ Q) → Q → (P → R)

My code trying out what Mark said

have h1 := λ(pqrq : P ∧ Q → R ∧ Q) q p ↦
  have pq : P ∧ Q := ⟨p,q⟩
  have rq : R ∧ Q := pqrq pq
  (rq.left : R)

or even all in one line (I indented above with one space)

have h1 := λ(pqrq : P ∧ Q → R ∧ Q) q p ↦ have pq : P ∧ Q := ⟨p,q⟩ have rq : R ∧ Q := pqrq pq (rq.left : R)

but it is saying Line 1, Character 66

expected ';' or line break

Is there a way to break the problem and have many have's like h1(which itself embeds many have's) as above?
As the error says: a ; or a line break

Well I rewrote with the ; and now it says 'Line 4, Character 18 unexpected end of input' for the following:

have h1 := λ(pqrq : P ∧ Q → R ∧ Q)(q : Q)(p : P) ↦
  have pq : P ∧ Q := ⟨p,q⟩
  have rq : R ∧ Q := pqrq pq
    (rq.left : R);

Am I indenting it correctly? How should I write the have h1 for this have h1 : (P ∧ Q → R ∧ Q) → Q → (P → R)?
Can you make a #mwe explaining your problem? Your code doesn't compile for me as it stands.

Neat, so the closest to #mwe is the following file from the logic game, which I pasted below: 

import Game.Metadata

namespace GameLogic

World "IffIntro"
Level 7
Title "IffBoss"

OnlyTactic
  exact
  «have»

Introduction "
# BOSS LEVEL
This is an involved level. It doesn't require you to do anything tricky, but there are a lot of moving parts and it is easy to lose track of what you're doing.\\
\\
I recommend editor mode. Think about what this is asking you to prove and use `have` to give yourself any auxiliary facts that don't exist under your theorems.
"

Statement (P Q R : Prop): (P ∧ Q ↔ R ∧ Q) ↔ Q → (P ↔ R) := by
  have h1 := λ(pqrq : P ∧ Q → R ∧ Q)(q : Q)(p : P) ↦
  have pq : P ∧ Q := ⟨p,q⟩
  have rq : R ∧ Q := pqrq pq
    (rq.left : R);

I am on this level https://adam.math.hhu.de/#/g/trequetrum/lean4game-logic/world/IffIntro/level/7
, as for an #mwe file, I am not sure which imports I do need more; this is the actual repo https://github.com/Trequetrum/lean4game-logic/tree/main
Your example in the original post is much closer to a #mwe - you can use import Mathlib and verify the resulting code shows the error you want to ask about in https://live.lean-lang.org/

example (P Q R : Prop) : (P ∧ Q ↔ R ∧ Q) ↔ Q → (P ↔ R) := by
  have h1 := fun (pqrq : P ∧ Q → R ∧ Q) (q : Q) (p : P) ↦
    -- we're in the middle of defining h1 so indent two spaces
    have pq : P ∧ Q := ⟨p,q⟩
    have rq : R ∧ Q := pqrq pq
    (rq.left : R)
  sorry

Looks good, thanks! A bit confused, I swear the code I tried at first go did not work but now it does also:

have h1 := λ(pqrq : P ∧ Q → R ∧ Q) q p ↦
  have pq : P ∧ Q := ⟨p,q⟩
  have rq : R ∧ Q := pqrq pq
  (rq.left : R)
I think fun is idiomatic Lean 4 (and they might remove support for λ\lambdaλ at some point I guess, I'm not sure it's ever mentioned in the official docs)

Kevin Buzzard said:

I think fun is idiomatic Lean 4 (and they might remove support for λ\lambdaλ at some point I guess, I'm not sure it's ever mentioned in the official docs)

λ is discouraged in Library Style Guidelines : https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/style.html#anonymous-functions.

Great, finally cleared IffBoss Level 7 / 7 : in Intro to logic game

example (P Q R : Prop) : (P ∧ Q ↔ R ∧ Q) ↔ Q → (P ↔ R) := by
  have h1 : (Q → (P ↔ R)) → (P ∧ Q ↔ R ∧ Q) :=
    fun(h2 : Q → (P ↔ R)) ↦
      have h3 : P ∧ Q → R ∧ Q :=
        fun(pq : P ∧ Q) ↦ and_intro ((h2 pq.right).mp pq.left) pq.right
      have h4 : R ∧ Q → P ∧ Q :=
        fun(rq : R ∧ Q) ↦ and_intro ((h2 rq.right).mpr rq.left) rq.right
      iff_intro h3 h4

  have h2 : (P ∧ Q ↔ R ∧ Q) → (Q → (P ↔ R)) :=
    fun(h3 : P ∧ Q ↔ R ∧ Q) ↦
      fun(q : Q) ↦
        have h4 : P → R :=
          fun(p : P) ↦ (h3.mp (and_intro p q)).left
        have h5 : R → P :=
          fun(r : R) ↦ (h3.mpr (and_intro r q)).left
        iff_intro h4 h5

  exact iff_intro h2 h1

where iff_intro, and_intro .mp and .mpr are defined within the game context.
Wayne Ng Kwing King has marked this topic as resolved.
